results.title: Performance appraisal and personal development
results.brief_description: The principal aim of this video is to provide viewers with the knowledge and understanding of a performance appraisal system, the need for a positive and active role in the process and how the system will develop their performance and career prospects within an organisation. A manual accompanies this video and may be borrowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: Performance and development review. Part two

results.title: Performance and development review. Part one
results.brief_description: Two scenarios are presented, the first one being a less than ideal setting for a performance appraisal review, and the second one a more favourable setting. In between the two sessions the tape poses questions, then reflects back on the interview in light of the issues raised. Issues covered include effective management styles, dynamics, opportunities, preparation, personal focus, and dealing with problems.

results.title: Performance
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Donald Cammell, Sanford Lieberson, Goodtime Enterprises and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: James Fox is Chas, a working-class London hitman, who is violent, cunning and ruthless. His growing arrogance results in a murder which sets his gangster boss against him. On the run, and fearing for his life, Chas holes up in the basement apartment of an ex-rock star (Mick Jagger) who lives with his two bisexual girlfriends (Anita Pallenberg & Michele Breton). The two men experience an initial repulsion then increasing fascination with each other, and under the influence of hallucinogenic drugs, they begin slowly to merge personas. This startling, original film uses the techniques and experiments of underground cinema to investigate the dislocation suffered by both bourgeois and working-class sexualities when confronted by the permissiveness of the hippie subculture. Fox, hard and masculine, and Jagger, soft and androgynous, both give two superb homoerotic performances. The electric rock score includes original music by Mick Jagger, The Last Poets and Ry Cooder.

results.title: Perfect strangers
results.creator_credit: Stephen Poliakoff, John Chapman and BBC
results.brief_description: A drama with family, immigration and belonging the main themes. With a dreamy and slow atmosphere, this family history story unfolds with the use of family photographs as story telling tools. It’s a moving series about relationships and ancestors, history and reunion. Cast includes Michael Gambon and Lindsay Duncan.

results.title: Perfect diet
results.brief_description: Jo Pearson of the Channel 10 Eyewitness News presents a special five-part news feature on diet. Episode 1. Examines the basics of the Australian Nutrition Foundation’s Perfect Diet Pyramid. Episode 2. Highlights the dietary problems of teenagers and children and analyses the Beverly Hills diet. Episode 3. Looks at how fat assessment is carried out and the myth of cellulite. Provides an analysis of Dr. Atkins diet. Episode 4. Shows the characteristics of diets that make people fat and analyses the F-Plan diet. Episode 5. Examines the myths of dieting: e.g. honey is better than sugar, bread and potatoes are fattening and analyses the Scarsdale diet. No other credits available.

results.title: Perfect blue
results.creator_credit: Satoshi Kon, Takeshi Washitani and Manga Entertainment
results.brief_description: Pop-idol Mimarin Kirigoe quits her struggling girl-group CHAM to pursue a career as an actress, despite the protestations of her agents and numerous fans. Her initial resolve is tested when she receives a fax labeling her a “traitor”, but she stubbornly presses on, landing a small role in the sexy television murder mystery, Double Bind. When one of her agents is injured by a letter-bomb meant for her, and the website called “Mima’s Room” starts publishing intrusively intimate details about her daily existence, Mima finds herself caught in a downward spiral of paranoid delusion and regret, struggling to separate fantasy from reality, past from present. As her world fragments into a hallucinatory nightmare, Mima must battle her own inner demons, and protect herself from an obsessed stalker, who is violently murdering her associates. Based on the suspense manga by Yoshikazu Takeuchi.

results.title: Perdita Durango
results.creator_credit: Alejandro de le Iglesia, Andres Gomes, Canal+ Espana, European Script Fund, Mirador Films, Sogetel and Lolafilms
results.brief_description: The titular protagonist of “Perdita Durango” originated in the David Lynch film “Wild at heart”, as a character played by Isabella Rossellini. In this film Perdita (Rosie Perez) hooks up with Romeo Dolorosa (Javier Bardem) and the two cross the border into Mexico, embarking on a spree of violence, rape and murder. Romeo believes he is protected by unearthly forces and engages in voodoo rituals in order to appease the Gods and maintain his power. After robbing a bank, and crossing an old partner, Romeo agrees to steal a truck full of human foetuses for Santos, a paedophile and crime boss, who is to use them for cosmetic experiments. Romeo and Perdita decide to kidnap two gringos in order to kill, sexually abuse and eat them. A surrealistic action packed film, “Perdito Durango” dabbles in the dark arts as a backdrop to a violent spree of bloodshed and mayhem. Some scenes may disturb viewers.

results.brief_description: Demonstrates an array of familiar objects which when struck to make music. Features the playing of a variety of unusual and cultures and from our own.

results.title: Percussion instruments
results.brief_description: The timpani, snare drum, cymbals, tambourine, castanets, triangle, and celesta, underline the rhythm in music. Demonstrates simple basic techniques for playing each instrument, which are heard separately and together; illustrates some of the special effects for which each may be used.
